qas.question: What building did Bell use as a workshop?
What did Bell call his special spot in the back of the property?
What Native American language did Bell learn?
What special status did Bell get in the Mohawk tribe?
Where was the Six Nations Reserve located?

context: At the homestead, Bell set up his own workshop in the converted <a0_0>carriage house<a0_0/> near to what he called his "<a1_0>dreaming place<a1_0/>", a large hollow nestled in trees at the back of the property above the river. Despite his frail condition upon arriving in Canada, Bell found the climate and environs to his liking, and rapidly improved.[N 10] He continued his interest in the study of the human voice and when he discovered the Six Nations Reserve across the river at <a4_0>Onondaga<a4_0/>, he learned the <a2_0>Mohawk<a2_0/> language and translated its unwritten vocabulary into Visible Speech symbols. For his work, Bell was awarded the title of <a3_0>Honorary Chief<a3_0/> and participated in a ceremony where he donned a Mohawk headdress and danced traditional dances.[N 11]
